title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: SAN JOSE CHIAPA, Mexico  (Reuters) - The automotive industry's growing love affair with Mexico was celebrated here on Saturday as Audi executives laid the foundation stone for its first assembly plant in the Americas.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Volkswagen AG's ( VOWG_p.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: DE ) premium brand is joining a parade of automakers who have announced plans to build cars in a country that is seen as a doorway not only to the rest of North and South America but to the world.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Audi officials said the $1.3 billion plant will open in three years and eventually be the German brand's only source globally for its Q5 SUVs after it opens in mid-2016.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: "Mexico was chosen very deliberately," Audi Chairman Rupert Stadler told more than 500 industry and government officials outside the town of San Jose Chiapa in central Mexico.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: "It is situated between North and South America, making it a linchpin between the two regions."

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: He added that Mexico was an "ideal export base."

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: With numerous free trade agreements, a cheap, well-educated labor force, and proximity to the lucrative U.S. auto market, combined with growing demand in South America, automakers have been lining up for two years to set up shop in a country that could eventually overtake Brazil as Latin America's biggest economy.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Audi's ceremony came two days after Japanese automaker Honda Motor Co ( 7267.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: T ) said it would build a $470 million transmission plant in the central state of Guanajuato, near an $800 million assembly plant that is expected to begin operations in February 2014.

text: Other automakers who have announced plans to open plants in Mexico include Mazda Motor Co ( 7261.

text: T ) and Nissan Motor Co( 7201.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: T ), while companies already there - General Motors Co ( GM.N ) and Ford Motor Co ( F.N ) - continue to pump hundreds of millions into their plants.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: The new plants also are attracting supplier factories and more could be on the way as Nissan's Infiniti brand, BMW ( BMWG.DE ) and Hyundai ( 005380.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: KS ) are weighing the possibility of building plants in North America.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: When Nissan said in January 2012 that it would build a $2 billion plant in the central state of Aguascalientes to open in late 2013, CEO Carlos Ghosn called Mexico, where it has now two plants and is the market leader in sales, production and exports, a "key engine" to Nissan's growth in the Americas.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: The Japanese automaker exports to 115 countries from Mexico.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Last year, Mexico attracted $3.7 billion in announced investments by automakers alone, matching the U.S. total, according to the Center for Automotive Research in Ann Arbor, Michigan.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: IHS Automotive estimated that investments by automakers in Mexico over the next few years could total $3 billion annually.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: From 2000 to 2013, vehicle production in Mexico has risen almost 3 percent annually, compared with declines in the United States and Canada of 1.3 percent and 2.4 percent, respectively, according to Boston Consulting Group.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: That trend will hold through 2018 as Mexico's production is forecast to grow 5 percent annually, compared with 3 percent growth in the United States and a 4 percent decline in Canada.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Mexico is the eighth largest producer of vehicles in the world.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Audi executives touted Mexico's good infrastructure, competitive cost structures and existing free-trade agreements in picking the site for the new plant, which will cover an area the size of 400 soccer fields.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: They called the Mexian plant a "dream moment."

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: VW has a VW plant in nearby Puebla City and an engine plant in Silao.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: VW has said it wants to boost sales in the United States, the world's No. 2 auto market, to 1 million vehicles by 2018, including 200,000 from Audi.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: It is the same time frame in which VW has pledged to become the world's largest automaker.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Last year, VW's U.S. sales totaled more than 577,000, including 139,310 for Audi.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: The new plant in Mexico is also part of the automaker's plan for Audi to reach annual global sales of more than 2 million by 2020 with the aim of snatching the luxury crown from BMW globally as well as challenging its luxury rival and Daimler's ( DAIGn.DE ) Mercedes-Benz in the U.S. market.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: BMW and Mercedes have had production footprints in North America since the 1990s and each sell about twice as many cars in the United States as Audi.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Access to the lucrative U.S. market isn't the only draw though as Mexico has 12 free trade agreements with 44 countries, while the United States' 14 trade deals cover only 20 countries.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Xavier Mosquet, leader of Boston Consulting Group's automotive practice, said Mexico was the "better choice" over the United States for exporting to the rest of Latin America.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Also in Mexico's favor are the rising labor costs in China, lower transportation costs and even Mexico's own growing economy, industry officials and analysts said.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: And the Mexican work force is increasingly well educated.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Audi officials say 2,500 applicants, many with degrees, have expressed interest in the 3,800 jobs they will have at the San Jose Chiapa plant and they haven't even advertised the jobs yet.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Nomura said last August that Mexico could overtake Brazil as Latin America's top economy as early as 2022.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Mexico's annual economic growth is projected to increase 4.5 percent in that period, up from 2.1 percent annual growth from 2002 to 2010.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: Mexico also serves as a natural hedge for many foreign automakers against stronger currencies at home or disasters like the tsunami in 2011 that hurt the Japanese automakers, IHS analyst Guido Vildozo said.

title: Auto industry love for Mexico grows with new Audi plant
text: "It's probably one of the reasons why you're hearing that some of the other automakers are also kicking the tires," he said.

text: OMAHA, Nebraska  (Reuters) - Warren Buffett's son, Howard, will take over as Berkshire Hathaway Inc's nonexecutive chairman someday in order to ensure that Berkshire has the right chief executive in place, the elder Buffett said on Saturday.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: (Reuters) - Credit Suisse Group AG ( CSGN.VX ) sued the former vice president of its emerging markets group on Friday, claiming she stole confidential documents and trade secrets to transfer business to her new employer, Goldman Sachs Group Inc ( GS.N ).

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: In a complaint filed in Manhattan state court, Credit Suisse said Agostina Pechi sent confidential and highly sensitive company documents to her personal email account in the months leading up to her resignation, including databases, client contact information and sales team targets.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: The Swiss bank also accused her of conducting an "after-hours document raid" when she was scheduled to be on vacation in which she allegedly copied transaction documents related to a longtime Credit Suisse client.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: After Pechi resigned on April 2 and told the human resources department she was accepting a new position with rival Goldman Sachs, Credit Suisse launched an investigation into her departure and found 60 work emails in her personal account, according to the filing.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: The next day, those emails had been deleted and could not be recovered, the complaint said.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: "Upon information and belief, Pechi intends to use confidential Credit Suisse information to compete with Credit Suisse, and intends to provide this information to her new employer to specifically target Credit Suisse's clients," the complaint said.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: Michael DuVally, a Goldman Sachs spokesman, declined to comment.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman
text: A lawyer for Pechi could not immediately be located.

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman

title: Credit Suisse says ex-VP stole trade secrets in move to Goldman

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: DUBAI  (Reuters) - Dubai aims to triple its annual income from tourism to 300 billion dirhams ($82 billion) by 2020, which would involve doubling the number of its hotel rooms, a senior official said.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Tourism is crucial to Dubai's economy, which had a gross domestic product of around $90 billion last year; it supports the emirate's large retail industry as well as its hospitality sector.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Occupancy at Dubai's 599 hotels, which have 80,500 rooms combined, was 78 percent in 2012 as the number of visitors rose 9.3 percent from a year ago to 10.16 million, according to data from the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (DTCM).

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Helal Almarri, director-general of the DTCM, told Reuters that the emirate was likely to have more than 160,000 hotel rooms by the end of the decade and aimed to attract 20 million tourists annually by then.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Most decisions to build hotels would not be made by the Dubai government but by private companies.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: However, the Dubai government is active in supporting growth of the industry by providing infrastructure, marketing the emirate overseas, adjusting visa policies for visitors and expanding the network of the state-owned Emirates airline.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Saudi Arabia, India and Russia will be the main contributors to expected growth in tourist numbers, Almarri told Reuters.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "With Emirates airline and other carriers we focus very much on extending the routes to those markets," he said.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Dubai's main airport handled 5.85 million passengers in March, up 20.6 percent from a year earlier, according to airport authorities.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "Airport capacity is not on our critical list of issues to worry about," said Almarri.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "We can easily put on more flights at any time."

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Dubai is pressing ahead with a $7.8 billion plan to expand Dubai International Airport, and plans eventually to migrate traffic to an even bigger facility.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: MIX OF HOTELS Traditionally, Dubai has been known for five-star hotels, but more budget hotels have been built in the last few years, appealing to a wider tourist base.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Almarri acknowledged this was an important trend.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "The importance in our growth is to have a mix of hotels," he said.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "Over the last five years the hotel offering in Dubai has become more diversified."

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: At present, hotel guests stay for an average of 3.76 nights; hotel revenue was $5.13 billion in 2012.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Almarri said that to help increase the average length of stay, Dubai would build more entertainment facilities.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Plans for several theme parks have been announced in the last few months by companies backed by the government or Dubai's ruling family.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "I have every confidence that we will have over the next three to four years coming on line a significant number of tourist attractions which are purely entertainment-like theme parks," said Almarri.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Having been forced to provision heavily for bad loans following the collapse of Dubai's real estate market in 2008-2011, banks have become more prudent about financing large-scale projects.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: Almarri said the theme parks would be funded largely through public-private partnerships.

title: Dubai aims to triple tourism income by 2020
text: "Theme parks are procured rather than built in many cases, so come with their own financing packages - the rides are built elsewhere, so you will probably find that many governments around the world are encouraging exports," he said.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: MILAN  (Reuters) - Former Finmeccanica ( SIFI.MI ) Chairman and CEO Giuseppe Orsi, who faces a trial in June over allegations of corruption in a helicopter deal with India, was released from jail on Saturday, his lawyer said.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: Orsi was arrested on February 12 on a warrant alleging he paid bribes to win a 560 million euro ($727 million) contract to sell helicopters to India in 2010, when he was at the helm of Finmeccanica's helicopter unit AgustaWestland.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: Orsi, who resigned from the state-owned aerospace and defense group a few days after his arrest, denies any wrongdoing.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: He was released from jail because the terms that allowed prosecutors to keep him in custody ahead of a trial had expired.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: Orsi's trial will begin on June 19 after a judge ruled on Friday that there was enough evidence for a procedure to start immediately, legal sources close to the case told Reuters.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: In an e-mailed statement, Orsi's lawyer Ennio Amodio said on Saturday that his client had sought to bring order and transparency to a company hit by internal power struggles, and that he was confident truth would prevail at the trial.

title: Former Finmeccanica chief released from jail
text: (Reporting By  Silvia Aloisi ; editing by  James Jukwey )

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: PARIS  (Reuters) - European Union Internal Market Commissioner Michel Barnier, the EU's top financial regulator, called on the French government to pursue its planned reforms despite the Commission allowing two more years to meet its budget deficit target.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: Olli Rehn, the European monetary affairs commissioner, said on Friday France badly needed to unlock its growth potential and create jobs, adding Spain, Italy and the Netherlands as well as France - four of the euro zone's five largest economies - would remain in recession this year.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: France - which restated on Friday it would bring the deficit below 3 percent in 2014, only one year later than the original deadline - must pursue its retirement and labor reforms to boost its competitiveness and to overcome its unemployment crisis, Barnier said.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: "It's a moment of truth for the government which needs to have the political courage to carry out those reforms which will sometimes not be understood, and require effort," he told French radio Europe 1 in an interview.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble said the EU's decision was in line with the strengthened stability and growth pact because it allowed flexibility in meeting deficit targets.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: "But the commission also said, and that's very important, that with (the extension) come clear requirements for necessary reforms," he told Bild am Sonntag newspaper to be published on Sunday.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: "The commission and the German government agree entirely that we can't slow down in terms of reforms," Schaeuble added.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: EU finance ministers had given France until this year to bring down its budget shortfall below 3 percent of GDP and set the deadline for Spain for 2014.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: But while France expects its economy to expand by 0.1 percent this year, the European Commission forecast a 0.1 percent contraction.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: Granting more time is a victory for French President Francois Hollande, who won elections promising a focus on growth and less on austerity but has little to show for his economic policies after a year in office.

title: EU's Barnier calls on France to pursue economic reforms
text: (Reporting by Yves Clarisse and  Annika Breidthardt ; writing by Muriel Boselli; editing by  James Jukwey )

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: PARIS  (Reuters) - France's government dismissed a call to nationalize the Saint-Nazaire shipyard on Saturday but said it was committed to the survival of the facility after a South Korean shareholder threatened to sell its stake.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: The Korean company, STX Offshore & Shipbuilding ( 067250.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: KS ), has been hurt by a shipping industry downturn since the financial crisis and may also sell shipyards in Finland and China.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: The French government came to Saint-Nazaire's rescue at the end of 2012, helping it win new contracts to stave off the threat of bankruptcy, including a 1 billion euro ($1.31 billion) contract to build the world's largest cruise liner.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: It is faring better today but, since STX's announcement on Friday, unions have been calling for the state to nationalize the shipyard on France's Atlantic coast, one of Europe's largest and a symbol of French industrial prestige.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: The government already holds 33 percent of STX France, the company that owns and operates the Saint-Nazaire site.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: President Francois Hollande does not want another manufacturing failure on his hands as he struggles a year into his term to make good on a campaign pledge to pull French industry out of the doldrums.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: In a joint statement, French industry and finance ministers dismissed talk that Saint-Nazaire and the jobs of its 2,000 employees were under threat and said the government would continue to support its development.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: "STX France has strengthened its business in the past few months, thanks to winning big contracts, in particular on the export side," the ministers said.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: "Saint-Nazaire is therefore not threatened at all by the events in South Korea."

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: Saint-Nazaire will begin building a cruise ship in September for Royal Caribbean Cruise Line, to be delivered in 2016.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: Industry Minister Arnaud Montebourg told French daily Le Monde that nationalizing the site would serve no purpose.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: "The Saint-Nazaire shipyard needs more orders, not a new shareholder, because the site is working well," Montebourg said.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: "We met the conditions in December 2012 to land an order for a giant liner and we continue to work to ensure the long-term future of the site."

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: The yard built famous cruise liners such as the Queen Mary 2, commissioned in the early 2000s to sail between Europe and the United States.

title: France spurns call to take over Saint-Nazaire shipyard
text: (Reporting By Muriel Boselli; Editing by  Tom Pfeiffer )

title: JPMorgan CEO Dimon to meet with OCC examiners: WSJ
text: NEW YORK  (Reuters) - JPMorgan Chase & Co ( JPM.N ) CEO Jamie Dimon is scheduled to meet next week with bank examiners from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency in a meeting the bank requested, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

title: JPMorgan CEO Dimon to meet with OCC examiners: WSJ
text: According to the Journal, the meeting provides a rare opportunity for more junior examiners to talk to Dimon and will be held in the style of a town hall meeting.

title: JPMorgan CEO Dimon to meet with OCC examiners: WSJ
text: The meeting comes as JPMorgan faces a host of regulatory woes including potential market manipulation charges and continuing scrutiny by federal investigators over the events leading up to its $6.2 billion trading loss last year.

text: Dimon, meanwhile, is dealing with calls from shareholders to relinquish his role as chairman of the bank's board.

title: JPMorgan CEO Dimon to meet with OCC examiners: WSJ

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: NEW YORK  (Reuters) - JPMorgan Chase & Co ( JPM.N ) shareholders should vote against the re-election of three board members because they failed to properly oversee risk-taking that led to $6.2 billion of losses on the so-called "London Whale" trades, an influential proxy advisory firm said.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: ISS Proxy Advisory Services said in a report released late Friday that directors David Cote, James Crown and Ellen Flutter should not be re-elected at the company's annual meeting this month because of "material failures of stewardship and risk oversight."

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The report by ISS ratchets up pressure on directors to reduce Dimon's power at JPMorgan, the biggest bank based in the United States, as some stockholders push for more supervision of the outspoken executive.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: A statement from JPMorgan spokeswoman Kristin Lemkau on Saturday said: "The company strongly endorses the re-election of its current directors and disagrees with ISS's position."

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: ISS also renewed its recommendation from a year ago that CEO and Chairman of the Board Jamie Dimon give up one of those two titles.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: ISS said investigations of the derivatives loss, which surfaced right before last year's shareholder meeting, showed that JPMorgan executives need more independent oversight and that the company is too big and too complex for one person to be able to do both jobs.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: Shareholders will meet on May 21 in Tampa, Florida.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: They will vote on the re-election of the company's 11 directors and on a non-binding proposal from four institutional shareholders calling on the board to have a chairman who is independent from management.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: A similar advisory proposal failed to pass last year, receiving only 40 percent of the vote.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: That vote was five percentage points more than similar proposals at other companies that year.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The independent chair vote is developing into a major test for Dimon, 57.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: It comes as criticism, and sanctions from regulators, over poor risk management have piled up since the "London Whale" losses surfaced at the bank, which has $2.39 trillion in assets, the most of any U.S. bank.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The trading debacle has picked up the same "London Whale" nickname that hedge funds gave to a JPMorgan trader for the outsized derivatives bets he placed for the company.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The ISS recommendations on the re-election of directors shows the shareholder debate over governance of the company is broadening beyond Dimon.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The three directors who ISS singled out for replacement were members of the board's risk policy committee in December 2010 when the committee was shown a presentation by management that highlighted large profits from trading strategies in the firm's Chief Investment Office, where the derivative losses later occurred.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The presentation said the CIO strategies had contributed $2.8 billion of "economic value" since inception, with an average annualized return of 100 percent, according to a report released earlier this year by the board on its review of the matter.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: ISS said the large profits showed that the CIO had changed from a unit that hedged risks to "what was essentially a proprietary trading desk" and should have prompted the committee to act against the practice.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The company statement added: "While the company has acknowledged a number of mistakes relating to its losses in CIO, an independent review committee of the board determined that those mistakes were not attributable to the risk committee."

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: In its proxy statement for the coming meeting, the board said that the actions taken by the company after the "London Whale" debacle show it to be strong and independent.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: After the loss, the board added a member to the risk policy committee - new director Timothy Flynn, a retired chairman of auditor KPMG International.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: ISS, which researches proxy issues and makes voting recommendations to institutional investors, praised the company for putting Flynn on the panel and recommended that shareholders re-elect him as well as seven other directors.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: Last year, ISS recommended that all director candidates nominated by the board be elected.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The advisory firm said the JPMorgan board needs "refreshment" and the panel should search "for seasoned directors with financial and risk expertise" to replace Cote, Crown and Futter.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: Cote is chief executive and board chairman of technology and aerospace company Honeywell International Inc ( HON.N ); Crown is president of investment firm Henry Crown and Co, and Futter is president of the American Museum of Natural History.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: The company's statement on Saturday also said: "The members of the board's risk committee have a diversity and breadth of experiences that have served the company well."

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: ISS said it had discussed the board's independence and the qualifications of the risk policy committee members with the board's presiding director, Lee Raymond, on April 26 before reaching its conclusions.

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: Raymond is a former CEO and chairman of the board of Exxon Mobil Corp. ( XOM.N ) ISS criticized the board for deferring to management and said the panel "appears to have been largely reactive, making changes only when it was clear that it could no longer maintain the status quo."

title: JPMorgan shareholders urged to reject three directors
text: (Reporting by David Henry in New York; editing by Gunna Dickson)

text: NEW YORK  (Reuters) - Employment rose more than expected in April, pushing the unemployment rate to a four-year low of 7.5 percent, which could help ease concerns of a sharp slowdown in the economy.

text: Nonfarm payrolls rose 165,000 last month, the Labor Department said on Friday.

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000
text: March's payrolls were raised to 138,000, 50,000 more jobs than previously reported, and February's job count was revised up to 332,000, the largest since May 2010.

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000
text: Economists polled by Reuters had expected April payrolls to rise 145,000 and the unemployment rate to hold steady at 7.6 percent.

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000
text: The drop in the unemployment rate last month reflected an increase in employment, rather than people leaving the workforce.

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000
text: "Overall, a strong set of numbers which will reassure markets on that the U.S. economy is not as weak as it may have seemed given some of the earlier data, although it may not be strong enough on its own to see renewed talk of tapering QE."

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000
text: To me the bones of the data are looking really good right now.

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000

text: When the labor markets are firming up, they feel better about that."

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000

text: JAMES BARNES, SENIOR FIXED INCOME PORTFOLIO MANAGER, NATIONAL PENN INVESTORS TRUST CO., WYOMISSING, PENNSYLVANIA: "These are pretty numbers along with the revisions.

title: Instant View: April nonfarm payrolls up by 165,000

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: HOUSTON/NEW YORK  (Reuters) - The U.S. oil and gas renaissance that has bestowed unexpected prosperity on states from North Dakota to Pennsylvania and boosted distillate production to a record high in the Midwest is also causing pockets of fuel scarcity: just ask Arkansas.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Farmers, truckers and politicians there are up in arms over plans by Enterprise Product Partners ( EPD.N ) to end deliveries on a key pipeline that ships diesel and jet fuel from Texas on July 1.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Instead, Enterprise plans to reverse the line to ship ethane, chiefly used as a petrochemical feedstock, from the shale fields in Ohio and Pennsylvania to the Gulf Coast.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The Arkansas attorney general has appealed to federal regulators to intervene, local merchants warn of a "catastrophe," truckers fear a jump in prices and even a U.S. Air Force base is stocking up on extra fuel.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The controversy is the latest sign of how energy and infrastructure companies are rushing to adapt to the production boom that no one predicted five years ago.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: And while the eventual result should be a more modern, efficient U.S. fuel network, the changes are forcing some parts of the country to redraw decades-old supply lines.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: "When you cut off supply, it's not as if there's a lot of extra supply just waiting to be used," said Ron Leone, executive vice president of the Missouri Petroleum Marketers and Convenience Store Association.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: "You're going to have to scramble to make it up, and in that scramble there will be outages and shortages," he said.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Enterprise, which announced its plans for the so-called TE Products line in March, says demand for interstate shipments on the 230,000 barrels per day line has fallen sharply in recent years, and that it is not "commercially feasible" to invest an estimated $50 million to upgrade a parallel line.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Enterprise declined to say how much the pipeline was delivering on a daily basis now.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Local fuel groups argue it is an energy lifeline and that closing it will roil the local market, raising prices as fuel is fetched from further afield and sparking shortages when demand normally met by the pipeline shifts to other sources.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Arkansas, a state of 3 million people north of Louisiana and best known as the home of former President Bill Clinton, is not the first to see a darker side of the shale energy bonanza.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Northeast states have also fretted over fuel supplies following the closure of several refineries, partly because they could not compete with inland rivals running cheap shale crude.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The reversal would have a "significant, damaging effect" on business, the Arkansas Attorney General's office said in an April 25 filing to the U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), asking for Enterprise's plan to be rejected or at least suspended for seven months for an investigation to take place.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Enterprise declined comment on the filing.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: 'OUTAGES AND SHORTAGES' The TE Products line runs 806 miles from Texas via Arkansas to southeast parts of Missouri, Illinois, Indiana and Ohio.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Under the company's $1.5 billion Appalachia-to-Texas, or ATEX, project, it would reverse the pipeline and build an extension into Ohio and Pennsylvania to pump ethane gas, often produced alongside natural gas from shale reserves from the northern Utica and Marcellus plays, south to petrochemical producers on the Gulf Coast.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The plan emerges at a time when overall fuel supplies in the broader Midwest area are healthier than ever, with refiners running flat-out as a glut of discounted Canada and North Dakota crude pumps up profit margins, while demand is dimmed.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Distillate production in the PADD 2 region from Oklahoma to Michigan is at a record high, up almost 9 percent since 2007, while demand has fallen by 8.6 percent during the same span, according to data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: But regional traders say that broad trend is irrelevant for a narrow corridor including Arkansas, about a third of Missouri, up to a third of Illinois and parts of southern Indiana and Ohio that rely on the TE Products line.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: "I think it borders on being catastrophic," said William Fleischli, executive vice president of the Illinois Petroleum Marketers Association.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Tom Gabe, president and chief executive of Heritage Petroleum, an Indiana-based fuel distributor and shipper on the line, explained how customers on the TE Products line in North City, south Illinois, might now have to go 100 miles south to a different terminal Cape Girardeau, Missouri, to get fuel.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: If demand for fuel from that other terminal suddenly doubles to 3,000 truckloads a week, local prices will have to adjust.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: "The end user is going to pay more for his fuel," he said.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Other alternatives include the Explorer Pipeline, from southeast Texas through Oklahoma and central Missouri up to northeast Illinois, or the Explorer line through Illinois, to then be loaded into Buckeye Partners' ( BPL.N ) system to move east.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: But if the endpoint is Missouri or Arkansas, "you're driving the barrel," a Midwest oil products trader said, meaning trucking it from a source other than the TE Products line, adding freight costs.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The Association of Oil Pipelines says trucking products for 300 miles could cost 20 to 30 cents a barrel compared with 4 cents for a barrel shipped on a pipeline.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: AIR FORCE ANGST "Driving the barrel" is what the Little Rock Air Force Base and airlines at the Clinton Airport in Little Rock will have to do because no other major pipelines shipping jet fuel or distillates run through the center of Arkansas, traders say.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The one petroleum refinery in Arkansas, Delek US Holdings' ( DK.N ) 83,000 bpd plant in El Dorado, could make commercial jet fuel, but that would only reduce diesel output - emptying one cup to fill another, said Steve Ferren, executive vice president of the Arkansas Oil Marketers Association.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Delek declined comment on how the closure may affect its production.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The Air Force base in Little Rock will be topping up its fuel tanks to add an inventory buffer while it looks into alternative supply sources, says Mimi Schirmacher, a spokeswoman for Defense Logistics Agency-Energy, which sources energy for U.S. military forces.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: SHUTTING DOWN The 16-inch (40-cm) TE Products distillate pipeline runs alongside a 20-inch line that moves gasoline and natural gas liquids along the same route.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: The larger line could be reworked to allow it to transport distillate fuel as well, including the installation of more pumps, but the investment is not warranted, Enterprise says.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: "Every terminal and destination that is currently served by this pipeline, has and will continue to have other alternatives - including terminals served by other pipelines, terms attached directly to refineries, or terms served by barge," says Enterprise spokesman Rick Rainey.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
text: Adding to the concerns of traders, Enterprise is considering similar options for the 210,000 bpd Centennial line, which ships gasoline and distillates 795-mile from Texas to Chicago.

title: Analysis: Despite U.S. oil boom, some states fear fuel scarcity
